block.p: Sarah Willeman of Hamilton, Mass., took the second step toward a sweep of the equestrian triple crown when she won the American Horse Shows Association's Medal Championship at the Pennsylvania National Horse Show yesterday in Harrisburg, Pa.

Sarah Willeman of Hamilton, Mass., took the second step toward a sweep of the equestrian triple crown when she won the American Horse Shows Association's Medal Championship at the Pennsylvania National Horse Show yesterday in Harrisburg, Pa.

Willeman, 18, a Stanford University student, and her horse, Grappa, beat a field of 288 junior riders from 38 states and Canada in the 13-hour competition, which included a final test in which she changed horses for a ride-off with the runner-up, Jennifer Jones of Marion, S.C.
Willeman will ride in the third leg of the triple crown, the A.S.P.C.A. competition for the Alfred B. Maclay Memorial Trophy at the National Horse Show next month in Madison Square Garden.
Missy Clark of East Aurora, N.Y., coached Willeman to the medal victory. The trainer's award was the fourth for Clark in her 10-year.
